snippet: With the state's deficit expected to rise into the billions of dollars next year, California's incoming Governor, Pete Wilson, will take office in January facing a fiscal crisis that could severely restrict his adminstration's programs.    Mr. Wil...
lead_paragraph: With the state's deficit expected to rise into the billions of dollars next year, California's incoming Governor, Pete Wilson, will take office in January facing a fiscal crisis that could severely restrict his adminstration's programs. Mr. Wilson, who must present an outline of a balanced budget on Jan. 10, three days after he takes office, did not rule out the possibility of some form of new taxes in his recent campaign for the office.

headline.main: Fiscal Crisis Could Handcuff Wilson in California

byline.original: By SETH MYDANS, Special to The New York Times
